messages.message:
I tried to create a new Community account ahead of the Research sessions (cc @Natasha). The UI here says that the UK is a supported region, but if I then try my UK number, it tells me the region is unsupported.

(_I'll use authenticator app as the workaround, just sharing the inconsistency in instructions)_
Also slightly strange we hide the last 4 digits of my phone number in the second line but not the first line (please nobody call me)

Got it, thanks for flagging. @Xindi Xu let’s remove UK as an option for now?

@Dave do you know if any process for how to get our Twilio account registered as an entity in the UK? We must be a registered there given how may folks we hire there. Or if you think we should be asking someone else about how to do this, let me know.

It’s not something we’ve handled previously so I don’t have any insights that would start without me pulling up docs and starting from square one.

Last we had discussed @shaunak was taking on Twilio on the operational side for product related use like this. Shaunak, is this something someone on the team is suited to dive into? It comes up for most countries.

For now, I wonder if we should remove the list of supported countries since we aren't sure about them. It looks bad to tell users that it's supported in their country but users  later found out that they can't use it.
It's also bad when they try and it doesn't work :melting_face:. Is there any way that we can get more confident in the supported list?

There is an offering that can be purchased the pre-clears/runs the paperwork with about 40 of the major countries and does the work. It is an upsell to an enterprise plan that thus far we haven’t pursued. It’s all a question of paying to have it done vs. doing it ourselves and that cost analysis.
Is Shaunak the person who would decide if we can upgrade to that enterprise plan then? Or is that IT?
Shaunak, we are happy to assist his team in working with the sales team and have offered our assistance but to this point we haven’t proceeded.

Hi Following up on this.  @Dave I think we might need your help in setting up the enterprise plan etc, i.e. account management.  The SRE team owns the full end to integration and debugging on when there are issues.
If you have a plan that is already figure out let’s do it :muscle::skin-tone-4:

We held off reaching out the rep to schedule a call after our last discussion together, so I'll go go ahead and revive that email thread. I'll cc you in so we can get things moving. Anyone else I should add?
Thanks @Dave.  Please add me for now.
Aces, it's been sent so we'll see where things get rolling.
